itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Friday, June 14, 2013
contentencoded:
Microsoft is finally delivering a mobile version of its Office software to the iPhone today. Today's software release allows iPhone users to create and edit Word and Excel documents, and store them on the company's servers for easy access. So what took Microsoft so long?

Tom Warren, senior editor at The Verge, joins Marketplace Tech host Ben Johnson to discuss.
title: The iPhone gets an office, a Microsoft Office
description: Microsoft is finally delivering a mobile version of it's Office software to the iPhone today. So what took them so long?
